item.title: MA add a quote by Tionne Rogers
item.description: "I'll chase the demons away, Maus." -- Tionne Rogers

item.title: MA add a quote by Tionne Rogers
item.description: "Love can be more destructive than hate." -- Tionne Rogers

item.title: MA add a quote by Irwin Shaw
item.description: "There are too many books I haven’t read, too many places I haven’t seen, too many memories I haven’t kept long enough." -- Irwin Shaw

item.title: MA add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "Be yourself; everyone else is already taken." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: MA add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "Two things are infinite: the universe and human stupidity; and I'm not sure about the universe." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: MA add a quote by Mahatma Gandhi
item.description:
"Seven Deadly Sins
Wealth without work Pleasure without conscience Science without humanity Knowledge without character Politics without principle Commerce without morality Worship without sacrifice." -- Mahatma Gandhi

item.title: MA add a quote by William S. Burroughs
item.description: "A paranoid is someone who knows a little of what's going on. " -- William S. Burroughs

item.title: MA add a quote by Groucho Marx
item.description: "Politics is the art of looking for trouble, finding it everywhere, diagnosing it incorrectly and applying the wrong remedies." -- Groucho Marx

item.title: MA add a quote by Jose Marti
item.description: "The first duty of a man is to think for himself" -- Jose Marti

item.title: MA add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "The difference between the right word and the almost right word is the difference between lightning and a lightning bug." -- Mark Twain

item.title: MA add a quote by Lloyd Alexander
item.description: "Fantasy is hardly an escape from reality. It's a way of understanding it." -- Lloyd Alexander

item.title: MA add a quote by Søren Kierkegaard
item.description: "People demand freedom of speech as a compensation for the freedom of thought which they seldom use." -- Søren Kierkegaard

item.title: MA add a quote by Ralph Waldo Emerson
item.description: "If we encounter a man of rare intellect, we should ask him what books he reads." -- Ralph Waldo Emerson

item.title: MA add a quote by H. Jackson Brown Jr.
item.description: "Twenty years from now you will be more disappointed by the things that you didn't do than by the ones you did do. So throw off the bowlines. Sail away from the safe harbor. Catch the trade winds in your sails. Explore. Dream. Discover." -- H. Jackson Brown Jr.

item.title: MA add a quote by William Shakespeare
item.description: "There are more things in Heaven and Earth, Horatio, than are dreamt of in your philosophy." -- William Shakespeare

item.title: MA add a quote by Lewis Carroll
item.description: "And if he left off dreaming about you, where do you suppose you'd be?" -- Lewis Carroll

item.title: MA add a quote by Flaubert Gustave
item.description: "When will someone write from the point of view of a joke, that is to say the way God sees events from above?" -- Flaubert Gustave
